intro: Aidia chantonea, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Aidia chantonea is also noted for its role in supporting local pollinators and its potential use in traditional medicine.
